definitions: the main woody stem of a tree
a large, sturdy box or case for storing or transporting goods
the human body apart from the head, neck, and limbs
the elongated, flexible nose of an elephant
the main part of a blood vessel or nerve
examples: The tree's trunk was very thick.
She packed the trunk for the trip.
He injured his trunk while lifting weights.
The elephant used its trunk to pick up food.
The aortic trunk branches off into arteries.
